Java Puzzle #7: Inheritance and Visibility

05 Aug 2012

You are given the following two classes: Animal.java: [java]public class Animal { private final int height = 120; }[/java]

Tiger.java: [java]public class Tiger extends Animal { public int height; }[/java]

What is the output of the following three snippets: test1.java: [java]public class test1 { public static void main(String[] args) { Tiger t = new Tiger(); System.out.println(t.height); } }[/java]

test2.java: [java]public class test2 { public static void main(String[] args) { Animal t = new Tiger(); System.out.println(t.height); } }[/java]

test3.java: [java]public class test3 { public static void main(String[] args) { Animal t = new Animal(); System.out.println(t.height); } }[/java]

. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Answer

test1.java: [bash]0[/bash]

test2.java: [bash]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problem: The field Animal.height is not visible

at test.main(test.java:4)[/bash]

test3.java: [bash]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problem: The field Animal.height is not visible

at test.main(test.java:4)[/bash]
